headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  EINHORN, ELLEN A

docs.snippet: EINHORN--Ellen A. Beloved sister of 73 years. Rest in peace with mom, dad and loved ones we've lost. Heartfelt condolences to my dear nieces. Love Arthur, Wendy & family...
docs.lead_paragraph: EINHORN--Ellen A. Beloved sister of 73 years. Rest in peace with mom, dad and loved ones we've lost. Heartfelt condolences to my dear nieces. Love Arthur, Wendy & family

docs.snippet: EINHORN--Ellen, passed peacefully on December 30, 2013. We are heartbroken at the loss of our beloved mom and best friend. Funeral services will take place on Thursday, January 2, at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Avenue at 9:45am. E...
docs.lead_paragraph: EINHORN--Ellen, passed peacefully on December 30, 2013. We are heartbroken at the loss of our beloved mom and best friend. Funeral services will take place on Thursday, January 2, at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Avenue at 9:45am. Ellen is survived by her family Julie and Emily Einhorn, Felice, Dan, Sam, and Isabel Javit, and Arthur and Suart Welz. May you rest in peace with Sara and Izzy. You will be in our hearts forever; we love you. In lieu of flowers, please make a donation in Ellen's name to VSNY Hospice/Haven Hospice.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MCENTEGART, EILEEN, F.

docs.snippet: McENTEGART--Eileen, F.,84, passed away December 29, 2013, at her home in Katonah, NY. Born July 1, 1929, she graduated from The College of New Rochelle and earned an MBA from New York University. Her career began at M.W. Kellogg Company as a junio...
docs.lead_paragraph: McENTEGART--Eileen, F.,84, passed away December 29, 2013, at her home in Katonah, NY. Born July 1, 1929, she graduated from The College of New Rochelle and earned an MBA from New York University. Her career began at M.W. Kellogg Company as a junior engineer. In 1962 she joined Mobil Corp. as a computer programmer, retiring in 1991 as Manager of United States Computer Operations. She was on the board of All Saints Catholic Church in Dallas and was an active volunteer in pastoral work and social ministry to prisoners. She was a trustee of Manhattan College. Visiting hours at Clark's Funeral Home, 2104 Saw Mill River Rd., Yorktown Heights, NY, on Friday, January 3 from 2-4pm and 7-9pm. Mass of Christian Burial: Saturday, January 4 at 10am at St. Patrick's Church, 137 Moseman Road, Yorktown Heights, NY. Burial: Monday, January 6 at Holy Rood Cemetery, Westbury, NY. She is survived by her sisters, Mary McEntegart Welch and Kathleen McEntegart; her niece, Mary Christine Welch; nephew-in-law, Daniel Cullen; and grandnieces Nora and Gwenyth Cullen. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Providence House, Inc. 703 Lexington Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11221.

docs.snippet: CROUSE--Anna. The Board and Staff of Lincoln Center Theater are deeply saddened by the death of our beloved Anna Crouse. A longtime Director and an Honorary Trustee for many years, Anna was passionate about the Theater, particularly our theater. S...
docs.lead_paragraph: CROUSE--Anna. The Board and Staff of Lincoln Center Theater are deeply saddened by the death of our beloved Anna Crouse. A longtime Director and an Honorary Trustee for many years, Anna was passionate about the Theater, particularly our theater. She was feisty, informed, enthusiastic, intelligent, opinionated, generous and always loving, always caring. Indeed, Lincoln Center Theater probably would not exist today without Anna's early advocacy and devotion. We extend our sympathy and love to Tim and Lindsay who took such magnificent care of their mother in recent years. Anna was a formidable figure, and we will miss her every single day. J. Tomilson Hill Chairman, Board of Directors Andre Bishop, Producing Artistic Director

docs.snippet: EGGERTH--Marta. We mourn the death of our dear friend Marta and will never forget her magnificent voice and the joy she brought to us and her multitude of fans. We extend our heartfelt condolences to Marjan Kiepura and his wife Jane. Robert J Camp...
docs.lead_paragraph: EGGERTH--Marta. We mourn the death of our dear friend Marta and will never forget her magnificent voice and the joy she brought to us and her multitude of fans. We extend our heartfelt condolences to Marjan Kiepura and his wife Jane. Robert J Campbell, M.D., Cesare L Santeramo

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SCHWARTZ, FLORENCE PART

docs.snippet: SCHWARTZ--Florence Part, beloved mother of Edward, Susan and Steven, their spouses Judy, Jonathan and Jil, grandmother of Lisa, Samantha, Sarah and Benjamin, passed away on Friday December 27th. She was preceded in death by her dear husband Bernar...
docs.lead_paragraph: SCHWARTZ--Florence Part, beloved mother of Edward, Susan and Steven, their spouses Judy, Jonathan and Jil, grandmother of Lisa, Samantha, Sarah and Benjamin, passed away on Friday December 27th. She was preceded in death by her dear husband Bernard. Born July 24, 1921, she was a proud alumna of Hunter College, a lifelong liberal, lover of ballet and all things New York. She will be deeply missed by her children and grandchildren. Both of their memories are a blessing to us all. A memorial service will be held at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel at 1pm on January 3 followed by interment at Cedar Park Cemetery in Paramus, New Jersey.

docs.snippet: BACCUS--Barbara "Brett", died peacefully on December 29, 2013 in New York City, at age 79 after a brief illness. She is survived by her partner Diane Friedman, her sister Marcia Johnson, her brother-in-law Jay Johnson, her nephew Bret Johnson, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: BACCUS--Barbara "Brett", died peacefully on December 29, 2013 in New York City, at age 79 after a brief illness. She is survived by her partner Diane Friedman, her sister Marcia Johnson, her brother-in-law Jay Johnson, her nephew Bret Johnson, and her brother Barry Baccus. Brett's interests and successes were many and varied. An entrepreneur and connoisseur, she was also passionate about animals, always advocating on their behalf. She was a lover of the arts, mentoring young artists. She enjoyed a good martini followed by fine food and wine. She appreciated the finer things in life, while always showing empathy for others. Brett enjoyed and shared the good life with her beloved partner of 34 years, Diane. Brett and Diane were married on December 23, 2013. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to Fire Island Pines Care Center, PO Box 5333, Sayville, NY 11782. A life celebration will be held on January 2, 2014 at 6:30pm at their NYC home.
